text: The Longest Common Subsequence of two strings A and B is the longest string whose letters appear in order (but not necessarily consecutively) within both A and B. For example, the LCS of eleanor and naomi is the length 2 string no (or equivalently the length 2 string ao). Biologists: If these were DNA base or amino acid sequences, can you imagine how this might be a useful problem? 1. Write down small and trivial instances of the problem.
